pullRequest.body:
Add `degreeOf_XXX_le` where `XXX` is `sub`, `pow`, `sum`, and `prod`, following the analogous theorems for `degrees` & complementing the similar theorems for `degreeOf` but with `add` and `mul`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ degreeOf_pow_le`
`+ degreeOf_prod_le`
`+ degreeOf_sub_le`
`+ degreeOf_sum_le`
<details>

```bash

## more verbose report:
```

There is a building error, can you please fix it?

:v: quangvdao can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11630434761/job/32389361971)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11630434761/job/32389362336)

Thanks!

bors d+
Nicely spotted that these were missing!

Thanks!

bors d+

Please use the new sum notation
```suggestion
    degreeOf i ( j \in s, f j)  s.sup fun j => degreeOf i (f j) := by
```
Sorry, ave triuble typing momentariky
Same here
Can you prove the equality under `NoZeroDivisors`?
This should be a separate theorem (`degreeOf_pow_eq`) right? There are many cases where I would want to use the theorem without the extra condition.
Yes absolutely! Sorry for being unclear

Hmm, I think this is not immediate. The way I proved `degreeOf_pow_le`, it depends on `degrees_pow` which depends on `degrees_prod` which depends on `supDegree_prod_le`. And I don't know there is a version `supDegree_prod_eq` with equality.

So it seems like I'd need a different route to prove the equality version, which is both non-trivial and will complicate this PR. Also, most of the theorems in this file only states the `le` version and not `eq`.
Could you add a TODO then?
Done, thanks!
Oh, looks like you have added `NoZeroDivisors` to the `le` version, probably because you were experimenting with the `eq` version. Can you revert?

Yes, sorry! I think the `NoZeroDivisors` condition should be enough for proving equality for arbitrary products, right?

Sketch of argument: let `p = X_i^a * p_a(X not i) + ...` and `q = X_i^b * q_b(X not i) + ...`. Then `degreeOf i (p * q) = a + b` unless `p_a * q_b = 0`, which should not happen since `NoZeroDivisors R` implies `NoZeroDivisors (MvPolynomial  R)`, which we can prove by induction.
Can this be simp?
Good catch, just added (also for `degrees_neg`).

If you move this down the file, you can do
```suggestion
  simpa using degreeOf_prod_le i Finset.range fun _ => p
```
(untested)
Does `simp only [degreeOf]` work here?
Same as above (not very important).
If `f 0` then `Nontrivial R` is automatic, so we don't want to assume it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MvPolynomial/Degrees): add `degreeOf` theorems for -,^,,
